      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addInput(aln_Perceptron p)
      Adds input perceptron with a random weight
      void addInput(aln_Perceptron p, double weight)
      Adds input perceptron
      void addOutput(aln_Perceptron p)
      Adds output perceptron
      void backpropagate_in(aln_Perceptron p, double error)
      Receives errors (w_i,j * delta_j) from downstream perceptrons and stores them until a backpropagation can be made.
      void backpropagate_in(double y)
      Receives the correct training result from the application and calculates the error, backpropagating it to upstream perceptrons.
      void backpropagate_out()
      Sends backpropagation results upstream, modifying each perceptrons weights on the way.
      void debug()
      Prints debugging information for this perceptron
      void in(aln_Perceptron p, double d)
      Accepts inputs from an upstream perceptron
      void in(double d)
      Receives inputs from the governing application; implies there are no input perceptrons to this one; makes this perceptron an input node
      boolean isComplete()
      Tests whether this perceptron has sent out an activation value
      com.software.reuze.aln_Perceptron.InputIterator iterator()
      Makes the perceptron's inputs iterable
      void out()
      Consumes input values and produces output signal to downstream perceptrons.
      void out(double d)
      Send immediately, without activation function, the passed value; used for sending data from governing application; must only be used if this perceptron is an input node
      String toString()
      Returns string representation of a perceptron

        public void out(double d)

      • out

        public void out()
        Consumes input values and produces output signal to downstream perceptrons.

      • backpropagate_in

        public void backpropagate_in(aln_Perceptron p,
                    double error)
        Receives errors (w_i,j * delta_j) from downstream perceptrons and stores them until a backpropagation can be made. Please note differences from AIMA 18.24, p.734, which assumes a fully-connected network and the use of vectors.
        Parameters:
        p -
        error -

      • backpropagate_in

        public void backpropagate_in(double y)
        Receives the correct training result from the application and calculates the error, backpropagating it to upstream perceptrons. Please note differences from AIMA 18.24, p.734, which assumes a fully-connected network and the use of vectors.
        Parameters:
        d - correct result from example set

      • backpropagate_out

        public void backpropagate_out()
        Sends backpropagation results upstream, modifying each perceptrons weights on the way. Please note differences from AIMA 18.24, p.734, which assumes a fully-connected network and the use of vectors.

      • isComplete

        public boolean isComplete()
        Tests whether this perceptron has sent out an activation value
